iati-activity.title: WaterAid Ghana
iati-activity.description: WaterAid Ghana works to help some of the poorest communities gain access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene education. In Ghana we help over 50,000 people a year and also seek to influence national water and sanitation policies so that more people gain access to these basic needs. In Ghana, WaterAid works in six out of the ten administrative regions. These regions are where our local partners are located. The partners work in 31 out of the 110 districts nationwide. Over the years our focus has been on rural communities but we are expanding our work in urban areas, starting with a pilot urban project in Tamale, with the hope to extend it to other urban areas.
iati-activity.activity-date: Financial year that WaterAid (re)started activities within the country

contact-info.mailing-address: Open data at WaterAid, 47-49 Durham Street, London, SE11 5JD, UK

budget.period-start: Forward looking data for WaterAid's 2012-2013 financial year (1st April to 31st March) are drawn from WaterAid's approved aspirational budgets and are estimates as at March 2013. The actual figures achieved will vary depending on a range of factors including the securing of the funding needed, challenges faced in the countries, etc.
budget.period-end: End of WaterAid 2012-13 financial year (1st April to 31st March)
